availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel P. Shaver (Foster, Bracken County, Kentucky, merchant. )

body.p: Foster, Bracken County, Kentucky, merchant. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel P. Shaver and Jane Shaver. Resident of Bracken County in 1850. Day laborer in Bracken County in 1860. Retail liquor distributor in Bracken County, Kentucky in 1863. Coffeehouse owner in Bracken County in 1863. Rented a room in George Sanders Kimberly's blacksmith shop and apartment building between the dates of January 01 and March 10, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, p. 426A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, District 1, p. 245.
Internal Revenue Assessment Lists for Kentucky, 1862-1918 NARA RG 58, Microfilm Series M768, Roll 15, Bracken County, Kentucky, 1863, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
KYR-0001-004-0088.
